name: XLIFF Localization File
summary: Learn about .XLIFF files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: Software developers and translators use XLIFF files to manage translation in applications, websites, and documentation. The format maintains the source text separate from the translated text, helping prevent errors and making it easier to update or reuse translations.

description: An XLIFF file is a localization file that stores language translation data in the XML Localization Interchange File Format (XLIFF) standard. It contains the original text from a software program or document, along with its translations into one or more target languages. The Organization for the Advancement of Structured Information Standards (OASIS) developed the XLIFF format to make it easier to exchange translation information among different localization tools.

instructions: You can open XLIFF files with several translation management programs, such as RWS Trados Studio, OmegaT, and Maxprograms Swordfish. Text or XML editors, such as Microsoft Visual Studio Code, Notepad++, or SyncRO Soft oXygen XML Editor, can also open XLIFF files.
